availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary Ann McGlone. Father of Elizabeth McGlone, John McGlone, William Owen McGlone, Robert H. McGlone, James McGlone, Lucinda McGlone, Squire McGlone, Joseph McGlone, Margarette Ann McGlone, Alfred McGlone, Sarah H. McGlone, and Ambrose McGlone. Resident of Greenup County in 1830. Owned one enslaved person in 1830. Resident of Carter County in 1840. Farmer in Carter County in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States(1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 70
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States(1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 254.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 230B-231A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 158.
"Death of a Noted Old Citizen," The Louisville Daily Journal, September 16, 1867.
Robert E. McGlone and Thomas H. McGlone, The McGlones: A Series on the McGlone Name as Researched in the United States, (McGlone and Associates, 1980), pp. 28-39.
"Owen Thomas McGlone (1777-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial 132749091, accessed June 27, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132749091.
